formattedAddress: 20 Waterside Plaza, New York, NY 10010, USA
adrFormatAddress: 20 Waterside Plaza, New York, NY 10010, USA

originalText.text: Don't understand all the negative reviews here. Probably these folks don't read or pay attention to the site's very clear description or don't comply with instructions, such as not trying to argue with box office staff about their FREE Broadway seat locations, loudly complaining about a show publicly, or other such bad behavior. I've been a member for several months now and my low  membership fee has allowed me to see Broadway and Off-Broadway shows for a minimal $4.50 service charge each time. I'm already way ahead financially, seen some great shows, and my yearly membership isn't even close to being over.  Thanks, Club Free Time!!  A+

originalText.text: Its a bit of a scam on a few fronts.  Its hard to figure out how the site actually works.  Its  subscription.  But the unforgiveable is the way they pretend to be an official source - or the ONLY source - for event tickets.  In truth they're not.  They even pretend to be the gatekeeper for events that are totally free.  Sadly, Google allows this and often features clubfreetime high in their results.  Very disingenuous.  If you see an event on clubfreetime, search elsewhere for info on how/when/where/price - you'll be pleasantly surprised.

originalText.text: We've been members of Club Free Time for a month, and absolutely love it.  We go at least once or twice a week!  We've seen so many shows and movies that we wouldn't have taken a chance on at full price. The vast majority were fantastic, and even those that weren't were at least eye-opening, and we've never regretted "splurging" the $4.50 each for reservations.  We love "Fight Club," as we fondly call it!

originalText.text: I have been a member for many years.   I always look on the site to experience the best shows tours and cultural experiences New York has to offer .  Just saw a play at Manhattan center last weekend. You'd be foolish not to give the site a try you will be pleasantly surprised at the top quality shows and tours the site offers all you pay is the booking fee. And no its not always front row seats , if you need any special accommodations I would email them first before buying any tickets,  their customer service is always on point and will not steer you wrong

originalText.text: Visiting NYC for two weeks. Traveled to Bryant Park via Taxi for 12:30 PM Jazz May 31 2022 Piano Free concert which never happened. Cost the two of us $50+ for lunch and cab fare for NADA. Then tried to book free play same evening and was advised required 1 year subscription upgrade plus reservation fees. Please refund my original form of payment as this was misrepresented.
